column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The first time I came here in 2007
column2: they had a special exhibit called Cézanne to Picasso: Ambroise Vollard
column3: Patron of the Avant-Garde. I was in heaven. I enjoy Cézanne's work along with Picasso
column4: so it was great. On my recent visit
column5: I went straight to the Impressionism and Post-Impresionism gallery where they have Monet
column9: and Seurat. My two favorite paintings were Renoir's Two Sisters and Seurat's A Sunday on La Grande Jatte. Because I was pressed for time
column10: I checked out the American Gothic painting and the Buddha statue. In the museum guide
column11: it gives you a must-see list if you don't have time to browse through all of their galleries. You can spend days here and still not see everything.
